hooks.command: powershell -Command "$cmd='{{command}}'; if ($cmd -match 'npm install|yarn add|pnpm add|dotnet add|nuget install') { Write-Host 'Dependencies updated. Consider running build...' }"
powershell -Command "$cmd='{{command}}'; if ($cmd -match 'git commit') { Write-Host 'Commit created. Remember to push changes.' }"
powershell -Command "$logPath = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.claude\session-log.txt'; Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value \"[$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')] User prompt submitted\""
hooks.description: Log all user prompts with timestamp

hooks.command: powershell -Command "$logPath = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.claude\session-log.txt'; Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value \"[$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')] Task completed\""

hooks.prompt: Check if verification is needed: Were code files modified during this task? If yes, consider running tests or build to validate changes.
hooks.description: Prompt to trigger verification after implementation tasks

hooks.prompt: Review subagent results: Did the subagent complete successfully? Were there any errors or issues that need follow-up?

hooks.command: powershell -Command "$logPath = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.claude\session-log.txt'; Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value '========================================'; Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value \"[$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')] New session started\"; Add-Content -Path $logPath -Value \"Working directory: $(Get-Location)\""

powershell -Command "if (Test-Path '*.sln') { Write-Host '.NET Solution detected' } elseif (Test-Path '*.csproj') { Write-Host '.NET Project detected' } elseif (Test-Path 'package.json') { Write-Host 'Node.js project detected' } elseif (Test-Path 'requirements.txt') { Write-Host 'Python project detected' }"

powershell -Command "$file='{{file_path}}'; $backupDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.claude\backups'; if (Test-Path $file) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $backupDir | Out-Null; $timestamp = Get-Date -Format 'yyyyMMdd_HHmmss'; $backupPath = Join-Path $backupDir \"${timestamp}_$([System.IO.Path]::GetFileName($file))\"; Copy-Item $file $backupPath -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }"
